comments.body:
The [documentation](http://highlightjs.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api.html#highlightauto-value-languagesubset) does not include a `top` member. When testing, it's actually there.
I've opened an issue on the [highlight.js repository](https://github.com/isagalaev/highlight.js/issues/570) to see if it is just missing in the docs or if there shouldn't be one.

For now, this shouldn't be a critical thing.
As stated at the issue at highlight.js, the top Variable doesn't make any sense on this return object but it's there for technical reasons.
Maybe we should split the inheritance to a HighlightResultBase, HightlightResult and AutoHighlightResult where only the HighlightResult has a top property.
